meanings.definition: Leader or head of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The chief of the tribe led the hunting expedition.
meanings.sent2: The police chief oversees the entire department.
meanings.sent3: The chief of the kitchen crew always had the best recipes.
meanings.sent4: She was the chief of the debate team, always leading them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The chief of the pack protected the younger wolves from danger.

meanings.sent1: The chief reason for his success was hard work.
meanings.sent2: The chief concern of the community was safety.
meanings.sent3: Her chief goal was to make everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The chief star of the show stole the audience's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The chief ingredient in the dish was love and care.

meanings.sent1: The chief executive officer made all the big decisions.
meanings.sent2: The chief justice presided over the court with wisdom.
meanings.sent3: The chief ruler of the land was known for his fairness.
meanings.sent4: The chief officer of the navy commanded respect from all sailors.
meanings.sent5: The chief supervisor ensured that everything ran smoothly.
